subject: Law
title: Felonies vs. Misdemeanors
description: A short lesson to help you apply Felonies vs. Misdemeanors.

hook.text: Shoplifting a candy bar and armed robbery are both crimes. But the law doesn't treat them the same way.

buildup.text: Crimes are classified by severity. Felonies are serious crimes; misdemeanors are less serious ones.

discovery.text: Felonies carry more than one year in prison. Misdemeanors carry up to one year, usually in county jail.

twist.text: A felony conviction has lifelong consequences: lost voting rights, difficulty finding jobs, and housing barriers.

climax.text: Some offenses wobble: prosecutors can charge them as either felonies or misdemeanors based on circumstances.

punchline.text: The label changes your life. Felony vs. misdemeanor is everything.

quiz.question: What distinguishes a felony from a misdemeanor?
